name: cloudamqp
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing CloudAMQP resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cloudamqp` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing CloudAMQP resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp)
> distributed under [MIT](https://mit-license.org/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-cloudamqp` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-cloudamqp/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-cloudamqp` repo](https://github.com/cloudamqp/terraform-provider-cloudamqp/issues).

apikey.description: Key used to authentication to the CloudAMQP Customer API

baseurl.description: Base URL to CloudAMQP Customer website

enableFasterInstanceDestroy.description: Skips destroying backend resources on 'terraform destroy'

settings.description:
Array of one or more settings to be copied. Allowed values:
[alarms, config, definitions, firewall, logs, metrics, plugins]

See more below, [copy settings].

subscriptionId.description:
Instance identifier of the CloudAMQP instance to copy the settings
from.

connectionString.description: Azure Application Insights Connection String for authentication.

iamExternalId.description: AWS IAM external ID for role assumption.

iamRole.description: AWS IAM role ARN with PutMetricData permission for CloudWatch integration.

region.description: AWS region for CloudWatch metrics.

tags.description: Additional tags to attach to metrics. Format: `key=value,key2=value2`.

rabbitmqDashboardMetricsFormat.description: Enable metric name transformation to match Datadog's RabbitMQ dashboard format. Default: `false`. **Note:** This option is only available for RabbitMQ clusters, not LavinMQ clusters.

region.description: Datadog region code. Valid values: `us1`, `us3`, `us5`, `eu1`.

tags.description: Additional tags to attach to metrics. Format: `key=value,key2=value2`.

accessToken.description: Dynatrace access token with 'Ingest metrics' permission.

tags.description: Additional tags to attach to metrics. Format: `key=value,key2=value2`.

apiKey.description: New Relic API key for authentication.

region.description: New Relic region code. Valid values: `eu`, `us`.

Additional tags to attach to metrics. Format: `key=value,key2=value2`.

token.description: Splunk HEC (HTTP Event Collector) token for authentication.

clientEmail.description: Google service account client email (extracted from credentials file).

credentialsFile.description: Base64-encoded Google service account key JSON file with 'Monitoring Metric Writer' permission.

privateKey.description: Google service account private key (extracted from credentials file).

privateKeyId.description: Google service account private key ID (extracted from credentials file).

projectId.description: Google Cloud project ID (extracted from credentials file).

tags.description:
Additional tags to attach to metrics. Format: `key=value,key2=value2`.

The following computed attributes are available:

type.description: Type of responder. [`team`, `user`, `escalation`, `schedule`]

username.description: Username of the responder Responders of type `team`, `escalation` and `schedule` can use either id or name. While `user` can use either id or username.

description.description:
Description name of the rule. e.g. Default.

Pre-defined services for RabbitMQ:

| Service name | Port  |
|--------------|-------|
| AMQP         | 5672  |
| AMQPS        | 5671  |
| HTTPS        | 443   |
| MQTT         | 1883  |
| MQTTS        | 8883  |
| STOMP        | 61613 |
| STOMPS       | 61614 |
| STREAM       | 5552  |
| STREAM_SSL   | 5551  |

Pre-defined services for LavinMQ:

| Service name | Port  |
|--------------|-------|
| AMQP         | 5672  |
| AMQPS        | 5671  |
| HTTPS        | 443   |
| MQTT         | 1883  |
| MQTTS        | 8883  |

ip.description: CIDR address: IP address with CIDR notation (e.g. 10.56.72.0/24)

services.description: Pre-defined service ports, see table below

certificates.description:
A list of certificate blocks (1-100 certificates). Each
certificate block contains:

content.description: **NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations. PEM-encoded x.509 formatted leaf certificate content. Updates require incrementing `version` or changing `key_id`.

name.description: A unique identifier for the certificate.

cacert.description: **NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations. PEM-encoded CA certificates used to verify the HTTPS connection to the trust store URL. Updates require incrementing `version` or changing `key_id`.

url.description: URL to fetch trust store certificates from. RabbitMQ will periodically fetch CA certificates from this URL according to the `refresh_interval`.

plan.description: The subscription plan used for the instance.

region.description: The region were the instanece is located in.

tags.description: Optional tags set for the instance.

region.description: The region the VPC is hosted in.

tags.description: Optional tags set for the VPC.

vpcName.description: VPC name given when hosted at the cloud provider.

messageType.description: Message type `(total, unacked, ready)` used by queue alarm type.

queueRegex.description: Regular expression for which queue to check.

recipients.description: Identifier for recipient to be notified.

reminderInterval.description:
The reminder interval (in seconds) to resend the alarm if not resolved.
Set to 0 for no reminders.

timeThreshold.description: The time interval (in seconds) the `value_threshold` should be active before trigger an alarm.

type.description:
The alarm type to filter for. Supported
alarm types.

valueCalculation.description:
Disk value threshold calculation, `(fixed, percentage)` of disk space
remaining.

valueThreshold.description: The value threshold that triggers the alarm.

vhostRegex.description: Regular expression for which vhost to check

availabilityZone.description: Availability zone the node is hosted in.

erlangVersion.description: Currently used Erlang version on the node.

hostname.description: External hostname assigned to the node.

hostnameInternal.description: Internal hostname assigned to the node.

rabbitmqVersion.description: Currently configured Rabbit MQ version on the node.

options.description: Options argument (e.g. `rk` used for VictorOps routing key).

value.description: The notification endpoint, where to send the notification.

description.description: Description of what the plugin does.

require.description: Min. required Rabbit MQ version to be used.

description.description: Description of what the plugin does.

enabled.description: Enable or disable information for the plugin.

version.description: Rabbit MQ version that the plugins are shipped with.

provider.description:
The provider type for the cloudamqp package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

cloudamqp:index/customCertificate:Custom.description: This resource allows you to upload a custom certificate to all servers in your cluster. Update is not supported, all changes require replacement. `ca`, `cert` and `private_key` all use **WriteOnly**, meaning no information is present in plan phase, logs or stored in the state for security purposes. > **WARNING:** Please note that when uploading a custom certificate or restoring to default certificate, all current connections will be closed. > **Note:** Destroying this resource will restore the cluster to use the default CloudAMQP certificate. Only available for dedicated subscription plans running ***RabbitMQ***.

ca.description:
**NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations.
The PEM-encoded Certificate Authority (CA).

cert.description:
**NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations.
The PEM-encoded server certificate.

keyId.description: A string based argument to trigger force new (default: "").

privateKey.description:
**NOTE:** This field is write-only and its value will not be updated in state as part of read operations.
The PEM-encoded private key corresponding to the certificate.

sniHosts.description: A hostname (Server Name Indication) that this certificate applies to.

version.description: An integer based argument to trigger force new (default: 1).

apikey.description:
API key needed to communicate to CloudAMQP's second API. The second API is used
to manage alarms, integration and more, full description [CloudAMQP API].

backend.description: Information if the CloudAMQP instance runs either RabbitMQ or LavinMQ.

copySettings.description:
Copy settings from one CloudAMQP instance to a new. Consists of
the block documented below.

dedicated.description: Information if the CloudAMQP instance is shared or dedicated.

host.description: The external hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

hostInternal.description: The internal hostname for the CloudAMQP instance.

keepAssociatedVpc.description:
Keep associated VPC when deleting instance. Default set to
false.

noDefaultAlarms.description: Set to true to not create default alarms

nodes.description: Number of nodes, 1, 3 or 5 depending on plan used. Only needed for legacy plans, will otherwise be computed. ***Deprecated:*** Legacy subscriptions plan can still change this to scale up or down the instance. New subscriptions plans use the plan to determine number of nodes. In order to change number of nodes the `plan` needs to be updated.

preferredAzs.description: The AZs to place your nodes in. Each entry corresponds to a server in your cluster, so for a 3 node cluster, provide 3 AZs in the list. ***Note:*** `preferred_az` can only be set upon instance creation as of now and the result is not guaranteed. On eventual failed resource allocation in the zone, CloudAMQP will fallback to a different zone. * AWS: AZ id in [aws-availability-zones] * Azure: 1,2 or 3 in supported regions [azure-region-list] * GCP: zones in [gcp-region-zones] * Digital Ocean: Slug in [do-regional-availability] ___ The `copy_settings` block consists of:

ready.description: Flag describing if the resource is ready

region.description:
The region to host the instance in. See available [regions].

***Note:*** Changing region will force the instance to be destroyed and a new created in the new
region. All data will be lost and a new name assigned.

rmqVersion.description:
The Rabbit MQ version. Can be left out, will then be set to
default value used by CloudAMQP API.

***Note:*** There is not yet any support in the provider to change the RMQ version. Once it's set
in the initial creation, it will remain.

tags.description:
One or more tags for the CloudAMQP instance, makes it possible to
categories multiple instances in console view. Default there is no tags assigned.

url.description:
The AMQP URL (uses the internal hostname if the instance was created with VPC).
Has the format: `amqps://{username}:{password}@{hostname}/{vhost}`

vhost.description: The virtual host used by Rabbit MQ.

vpcId.description:
The VPC ID. Use this to create your instance in an existing
VPC. See available [example].

vpcSubnet.description:
Creates a dedicated VPC subnet, shouldn't overlap with other
VPC subnet, default subnet used 10.56.72.0/24.

***Deprecated:*** Will be removed in next major version (v2.0)

***Note:*** Extra fee will be charged when using VPC, see [CloudAMQP] for more information.

apiKey.description: The API key for the integration service. (Datadog)

application.description: The name of the application. (Azure Monitor)

dcrId.description: ID of data collection rule that your DCE is linked to.

endpoint.description: The syslog destination to send the logs to. (Papertrail)

instanceId.description:
Instance identifier for the CloudAMQP instance. Valid arguments for each third party log integrations below. Corresponding API backend documentation can be found here [CloudAMQP API add integration].
Azure monitoring The following arguments used by Azure monitoring.

name.description: The name of the third party log integration (`cloudwatchlog`).

privateKey.description: The private API key used for authentication. (Stackdriver, Coralogix)

projectId.description: The project ID for the integration service. (Stackdriver)

region.description:
AWS region hosting the integration service.

Optional arguments introduced in version [v1.38.0].

retention.description:
Number of days to retain log events in `CloudAMQP` log group.

***Note:*** Possible values are: 0 (never expire) or between 1-3653, read more about valid values in
the [Cloudwatch Log retention].

sourcetype.description: Assign source type to the data exported, eg. generic_single_line. (Splunk)

subsystem.description: The name of the subsystem. (Azure Monitor)

table.description:
The table name. Use Azure portal to configure external access for Azure Monitor. [Tutorial to find/create all arguments]
Cloudwatch The following arguments used by CloudWatch.

tags.description:
Enter tags to `CloudAMQP` log group like this: `Project=A,Environment=Development`.

***Note:*** Tags are only added, unwanted tags needs to be removed manually in the AWS console.
Read more about tags format in the [Cloudwatch Log tags]

token.description: The token used for authentication. (Loggly, Logentries, Splunk, Scalyr)

url.description: The URL to push the logs to. (Papertrail)

Instance identifier for the CloudAMQP instance. Valid arguments for each third party log integrations below. Corresponding API backend documentation can be found here [CloudAMQP API add integration].
Azure monitoring The following arguments used by Azure monitoring.

name.description: The name of the third party log integration (`cloudwatchlog`).

privateKey.description: The private API key used for authentication. (Stackdriver, Coralogix)

projectId.description: The project ID for the integration service. (Stackdriver)

region.description:
AWS region hosting the integration service.

Optional arguments introduced in version [v1.38.0].

retention.description:
Number of days to retain log events in `CloudAMQP` log group.

***Note:*** Possible values are: 0 (never expire) or between 1-3653, read more about valid values in
the [Cloudwatch Log retention].

sourcetype.description: Assign source type to the data exported, eg. generic_single_line. (Splunk)

subsystem.description: The name of the subsystem. (Azure Monitor)

table.description:
The table name. Use Azure portal to configure external access for Azure Monitor. [Tutorial to find/create all arguments]

cannot be configured for Entra ID v2.

the base URL of your OAuth2 provider (e.g., Auth0, Keycloak, etc.).

used when obtaining access tokens.

preferredUsernameClaims.description:

The first claim found in the token will be used as the username.

resourceServerId.description:

server in OAuth2 tokens.

mapping OAuth2 scopes to RabbitMQ permission tags.

the JWT token need to be prefixed for RabbitMQ permissions.
